content: The "Access to High Standards Act" may be cited as the short title of this legislation. The findings and purposes of the Act are outlined in Section 2. The "Access to High Standards Act" aims to address the lack of academic preparation in secondary schools, leading to limited employment opportunities and high college dropout rates. It emphasizes the importance of raising academic standards and modeling them after advanced placement courses. The "Access to High Standards Act" emphasizes the importance of raising academic standards and modeling them after advanced placement courses, which are already providing 30 college-level courses to almost 60 percent of secondary schools and over 1,000,000 students. Advanced placement programs are endorsed by education leaders and almost half of all States. They offer 30 college-level courses to nearly 60% of secondary schools and over 1,000,000 students, with test scores accepted for college credit at over 3,000 colleges and universities. 24 States are funding programs to increase access to these courses. "30 college-level courses offered to nearly 60% of secondary schools, with test scores accepted for college credit at over 3,000 colleges and universities. 24 States funding programs to increase access to advanced placement courses." States support advanced placement programs by funding teacher professional development, requiring schools to offer AP courses, paying test fees for students, and granting academic credit for passing scores. These programs have raised academic standards and increased student participation. The Act aims to ensure public universities grant academic credit for scores of 3 or better on AP tests, showing success in raising academic standards and increasing enrollment and minority participation in AP programs. The Act aims to encourage more students to take AP exams to demonstrate their achievements and build on the benefits of advanced placement programs. The Act aims to encourage more students to take AP exams to demonstrate their achievements and build on the benefits of advanced placement programs, including acquiring important skills, higher SAT scores, and better grades in secondary school and college. The Act aims to support State and local efforts to raise academic standards through advanced placement programs, increasing student participation and success in these programs. The Act aims to increase student participation and success in advanced placement programs by supporting State and local efforts to raise academic standards and expanding the availability of these programs to a broader range of schools. The Act aims to increase availability and diversity of advanced placement programs in schools, especially for low-income and disadvantaged students.
